item.title: Nicole add a quote by Pema Chodron
item.description: "We think that the point is to pass the test or to overcome the problem, but the truth is that things don't really get solved. They come together and they fall apart." -- Pema Chodron

item.title: Nicole add a quote by mahatma gandhi
item.description: "I will not let anyone walk through my mind with their dirty feet." -- mahatma gandhi

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "The greatness of a nation and its moral progress can be judged by the way its animals are treated." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "My Life is My Message" -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Nicole add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "If everyone demanded peace instead of another television set, then there'd be peace." -- John Lennon

item.title: Nicole add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "I believe in everything until it's disproved. So I believe in fairies, the myths, dragons. It all exists, even if it's in your mind. Who's to say that dreams and nightmares aren't as real as the here and now?" -- John Lennon

item.title: Nicole add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "The thing the sixties did was to show us the possibilities and the responsibility that we all had. It wasn't the answer. It just gave us a glimpse of the possibility." -- John Lennon

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Dan Millman
item.description: "The journey is what brings us happiness not the destination." -- Dan Millman

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Marilyn Kaye
item.description: "Itâ€™s not the power of the curse, it is the power you give the curse." -- Marilyn Kaye

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "This is what you shall do; Love the earth and sun and the animals, despise riches, give alms to every one that asks, stand up for the stupid and crazy, devote your income and labor to others, hate tyrants, argue not concerning God, have patience and indulgence toward the people, take off your hat to nothing known or unknown or to any man or number of men, go freely with powerful uneducated persons and with the young and with the mothers of families, read these leaves in the open air every season of every year of your life, re-examine all you have been told at school or church or in any book, dismiss whatever insults your own soul, and your very flesh shall be a great poem and have the richest fluency not only in its words but in the silent lines of its lips and face and between the lashes of your eyes and in every motion and joint of your body." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Nicole add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Well, we all make mistakes, dear, so just put it behind you. We should regret our mistakes and learn from them, but never carry them forward into the future with us." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Charlaine Harris
item.description: "Hereâ€™s to books, the cheapest vacation you can buy." -- Charlaine Harris

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Samuel R. Delany
item.description: "It is a magic book. Words mean things. When you put them together they speak. Yes, sometimes they flatten out and nothing they say is real, and that is one kind of magic. But sometimes a vision will rip up from them and shriek and clank wings clear as the sweat smudge on the paper under your thumb. And that is another kind." -- Samuel R. Delany

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Diana Gabaldon
